title: Blackstone River Valley National Historical Park: Things To Do
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do             Things To Do              The Blackstone River Valley National Historical Park is still in the planning stages, but there are things for visitors to do right now both within the park and throughout the Blackstone Valley.  The Slater Mill offers programs (for a fee) The Blackstone River State Park is open dawn to dusk for you to enjoy the bikeway and other features. The Wilbur Kelly House transportation museum is open, for free, from April through October. Also, please check out our Calendar and our Outdoor Activities pages to see what else is going on in the Blackstone River Valley.        Spinning frame at Slater Mill   Self Guided Walking Tour Brochures If you would like to explore parts of the park on your own, please feel free to download one of our self-guided walking tour brochures.
